intro: Cryptantha densiflora, commonly known as the denseflower cryptantha, is a flowering plant native to the western United States. It belongs to the Leguminosae family, also known as the pea family, and is characterized by its small, clustered flowers. The plant typically grows in rocky or sandy soils and is often found in dry, open habitats. Its leaves are trifoliate, meaning they consist of three leaflets, and the flowers are usually pink or purple in color. Cryptantha densiflora is an annual or biennial plant that plays a role in stabilizing soil in arid environments.
